name: refrigerant R134a production | refrigerant R134a | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2159/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of tetrafluoroethane (R-134a). Tetrafluoroethane is a gaseous fluorocarbon with a faint ether-like odour. It is used primarily as a refrigerant for “high-temperature” refrigeration, such as domestic refrigerators and automobile air conditioners. Tetrafluoroethane is also used in heat pumps, both in pure form and in widespread refrigerant mixtures (WPZ). Other potential uses include application in plastic foam blowing, as a solvent for special cleaning applications, as an aerosol propellant for medical inhalers, and as a fire extinguishant in place of halons.;This dataset is based on data given in Frischknecht (1999). It is assumed that the tetrafluoroethane is produced 50% by hydrofluorination of trichloroethylene and 50% by hydrofluorination of tetrachloroethylene.;References:;R. Frischknecht (1999) Umweltrelevanz natürlicher Kältemittel; Ökobilanzen von Wärmepumpen und Kälteanlagen, Bundesamt für Energie, Bern. http://www.waermepumpe.ch/.;Wärmepumpen-Testzentrum (WPZ) Winterthur-Töss. Testliste. Stand April 2003. http://www.wpz.ch/

From reception of trichloroethylene and tetrachloroethylene at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of refrigerant R134a. Emissions during production process are included. This dataset doesn´t include an output of hydrochloric acid, however 1.07 respectively 2,2 kg of hydrochloric acid are produced both with the trichloroethylene and with the tetrachloroethylene process.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data are based on estimations and do not have a specific geographical origin. They are assumed to be representative of this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Several processes exist to produce tetrafluoroethane commercially. The most common are hydrofluorination of trichloroethylene or tetrachloroethylene (=perchlorethylene) and isomerisation/hydroluorination of 1,1,2-trichlor-1,2,2-trifluorethane.

exchanges.description: The refrigerant R134a (1,1,1,2-tetrafluoroethane , CH2FCF3)  is a chlorine-free refrigerant and is used as working substance in heat pumps both in pure form and as refrigerant mix. R134a has a GWP (100) of 1300 years.

exchanges.description: Estimation based on expert judgement. During manufacturing, the intermediate products HCFC-124 (trichloroethylene process) and CFC-113 (tetrachloroethylene process) are produced. HCFC-124 and CFC-113 belong to the group of chlorinated hydrocarbon fluids and have damaging effects on the climate and depleting effects on the ozone layer. The estimated emissions amount to 0.002 kg HCFC-124 per kg R134a produced using the trichloroethylene route.

Estimation based on expert judgement. During manufacturing, the intermediate products HCFC-124 (trichloroethylene process) and CFC-113 (tetrachloroethylene process) are produced. HCFC-124 and CFC-113 belong to the group of chlorinated hydrocarbon fluids and have damaging effects on the climate and depleting effects on the ozone layer. The estimated emissions amount to 0.002 kg CFC-113 per kg R134a produced using the tetrachloroethylene route.
